文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_017_chunk3
证据片段: When the $\pmb { \alpha }$ grains are equiaxed, the hydride platelets precipitate either at grain boundaries or on the basal plane

证据片段: A sufficiently high tensile stress perpendicular to the basal plane will precipitate the platelets perpendicular to the stress

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_017_chunk3
证据片段: When the grains are thin and elongated, the platelets precipitate along the grain boundaries

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_017_chunk4
证据片段: Zirconium alloys absorb up to 5 atomic percent hydrogen in solid solution at temperatures ≥ 775 K (500°C)

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_017_chunk4
证据片段: solubility decreases rapidly with decreasing temperature and the hydrogen precipitates as a hydride phase, ZrHy

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_017_chunk4
证据片段: There are three hydride phases, γ and δ where y = 1.5 to 1.67 and € where y > 1.69

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_017_chunk4
证据片段: The hydride phases have poor ductility, particularly at temperatures < 425 K (150°C)

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_017_chunk4
证据片段: On slow cooling hydrides precipitate as platelets, which are often preferentially oriented
